unnormalised: The price of tomatoes has hit a record high of â‚¹150/kg in some Delhi markets! Can you believe it? Just last month, they were selling for Rs. 30-40 a kilo. Seems like my aloo-tamatar sabzi is going to be just aloo for a while!
normalised: The price of tomatoes has hit a record high of rupee one hundred and fifty per kilogram in some Delhi markets! Can you believe it? Just last month, they were selling for rupees thirty to forty a kilo. Seems like my aloo-tamatar sabzi is going to be just aloo for a while!

unnormalised: Traders are saying unseasonal rains are to blame, impacting the tomato crop in Karnataka and Maharashtra. The supply chain is disrupted, and that's why we are seeing these crazy prices. Shopkeepers in my local market in Karol Bagh were quoting Rs 120 yesterday, and today itâ€™s gone up further. Some are even selling 'em individually for Rs. 10 apiece!
normalised: Traders are saying unseasonal rains are to blame, impacting the tomato crop in Karnataka and Maharashtra. The supply chain is disrupted, and that's why we are seeing these crazy prices. Shopkeepers in my local market in Karol Bagh were quoting rupees one hundred and twenty yesterday, and today it's gone up further. Some are even selling 'em individually for rupees ten apiece!

unnormalised: Consumers are feeling the pinch, especially those running small eateries. Many street vendors are reducing the quantity of tomatoes in their dishes or even taking them out completely to avoid losses. My chaiwala bhaiyya was complaining that even his cutting chai is costing him more now, due to the price hike in sugar which is now â‚¹45/kg.
normalised: Consumers are feeling the pinch, especially those running small eateries. Many street vendors are reducing the quantity of tomatoes in their dishes or even taking them out completely to avoid losses. My chaiwala bhaiyya was complaining that even his cutting chai is costing him more now, due to the price hike in sugar which is now rupee forty five per kilogram.

unnormalised: Experts predict that prices could remain elevated for the next 2-3 weeks until fresh supplies arrive. Until then, maybe it's time to explore some tomato-less recipes? Or perhaps invest in a small tomato plant? ðŸ˜‰
